plants.name: Witch Hazel
plants.description: A deciduous shrub known for its fragrant, spidery yellow flowers that often bloom in late winter before the leaves appear. It thrives in temperate regions and is often found in woodland gardens.
plants.funFact: Witch Hazel flowers release their pollen explosively in a rapid motion to aid pollination.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub widely appreciated for its large, rose-like flowers which bloom in the winter and early spring. Commonly found in gardens across East Asia and cultivated globally.
plants.funFact: Camellia oil, extracted from the seeds, is used in cooking and cosmetics in Asia.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: A fast-growing, frost-tender tree native to eastern Australia with bright orange to yellow spider-like flowers. It blooms during the southern hemisphere summer and early autumn, continuing into January.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Silky Oak is not a true oak but is valued for its decorative timber.

plants.name: Almond Tree
plants.description: This deciduous tree produces delicate pale pink to white flowers that appear in late winter to early spring, heralding the coming growing season. It is widely cultivated for its nuts.
plants.funFact: Almond blossoms are one of the earliest flowering trees in Mediterranean climates, often blooming even before leaves emerge.
